Description: A towering structure of black stone and stained glass, filled with pre-Catastrophe scrolls, arcane tomes, and lost histories. Maintained by scholars and whispered to be older than the town itself.
People: Scholars, scribes, apprentices, one Head Archivist (currently absent)
Facilities: Main reading hall, sealed Vaults below, scriptorium, restricted wing, rooftop observatory
Services: Research, translation, lore identification, rare book copying

Description: Deep beneath the Library, ancient mechanical halls sealed since the Catastrophe. Rumored to house lost technologies, pre-cataclysmic constructs, and forbidden devices.
People: None known currently. Previously overseen by the Mechanist Order (defunct).
Facilities: Arcane locking systems, mechanical chambers, cryptic archives, containment rooms
Services: Unknown—suspected to provide access to lost tech and relics if unlocked

Description: A crumbling chapel dedicated to Edras, god of dusk, memory, and secrets. Candlelit vigils are held nightly.
People: 1 Elder Priestess, 2 Novices, few faithful townsfolk
Facilities: Altar, confession crypts, herb garden, bell tower
Services: Blessings, spiritual guidance, burial rites, basic healing

Description: An aging manor on the northern cliff, occupied by Baron Veynar. Its halls echo with political scheming and isolation.
People: Baron Veynar, 4 house guards, 2 stewards, 1 secretive advisor
Facilities: Audience hall, war room, private garden, vault
Services: Tax collection, noble judgment, land deeds

Description: The heart of daily commerce, surrounded by wooden stalls and faded guild banners. Sparse trade flows in from the east road.
People: Merchants, peddlers, farmers, townsfolk, 1 market overseer
Facilities: Stalls, weighing station, dried goods storehouse
Services: Trade, rumors, barter, meal purchases, common supplies

Description: A smoky, dim inn known for bitter ale and stranger gossip. Frequented by guards, loners, and travelers.
People: Innkeeper Brana, 2 servers, 1 bard, rough clientele
Facilities: Common room, 4 rented rooms, cellar, gambling table

Description: Stone-walled quarters with armory and training grounds. Morale is low, and supplies are scarce.
Services: Law enforcement, militia hiring, minor disputes

Description: Main trade route entry. Weathered gate flanked by watchtowers and rusted portcullis.
Services: Entry control, toll collection, trade inspection

Description: Rarely used exit toward moors and forgotten paths. Less secure.
Services: Limited passage, secretive comings and goings

Description: Fog-covered graveyard behind the chapel. Graves vary from honored knights to unmarked paupers.
Facilities: Mausoleum, chapel crypt access, bone pit
Services: Burial, exhumation (rare), local lore, suspected hauntings
